Topic.Title: First GOOG submitd offer to buy Ad Tech THEN GOOG assignd Mayer to CEO

Message.Msg: The debate between GOOG n YHOO BOD is what is YHOO worth? $25 or $30 ? At $25 the deal would have been announced soon after Thompson was fired.... that is why Loeb was OK wilth Levinsohn as INTERIM CEO while a GOOG deal was being hashed out. BUT YHOO BOD wanted close to $30, and GOOG doesn't want an open bidding frenzy, so in comes Marissa to step in to do due diligence for couple months to firm up the worth and content of YHOO before finalizing the BEST AND FINAL OFFER.

Topic.Title: Well so much for any Marissa bump or strength. The only hope is a buyout but no one....

Message.Msg: Add in, that the word from the board seems to be they are prepared to give the new CEO the time she needs for a turn around. Then throw in the fact she is going to have to spend a bunch of cash to staff up for any move into products. Plus, it is likely she will loose Levinsohn and his crew and have to spend a bunch of time just stabilizing that part of the business before she can make a big product move. All that adds up to one big wait and see, but with lower earnings until the turn around takes effect and at a lower multiple. The Dream is Dead!!

Topic.Title: Dan Loeb Buys 2.5M Shares of Yahoo July 20-July23

Message.Msg: Daniel Loeb, head of hedge fund Third Point LLC, this afternoon disclosed that he purchased 2.5 million shares of Yahoo! (YHOO) stock last Friday, July 20th, and on Monday, July 23rd, at prices of $15.67 and $15.82, bringing the firmâ€™s total Yahoo! holdings to 73,000,400.

Message.Title: It's about Yahoo PPS, not Marissa
Message.Msg: How did we get here? Worrrying about whether Ms. Mayer "has it all", her personal life, etc. The stock is in the low $15s, it hit $18 several times during the Bartz era. Hate to tell Marissa, but with $300 million in Google stock, VP of Goog, she already has it all!! Sad that if a woman or man doesn't make it as CEO, they didn't get it all! Why didn't Google make her Chairman of the Board, or groom her as CEO? There's only 1 important thing, and it's that we Yahoo shareholders need a higher share price!!, and that's only going to happen through monetization of assets, better products, etc. We're in this situation because of the dummies before, especially the 2 founders, Yang and Filo, who together couldn't conjur up any good ideas while Google smoked us. Filo spends too much time selling and staring at his swelling bank account. At least Carol Bartz told them all to fk off.

Message.Title: Third Point's Loeb boosts Yahoo stake
Message.Msg: Yahoo was already the largest holding of Loeb's hedge fund firm Third Point and the new investment takes its stake to over 73 million shares or about 6 percent of the Internet company's outstanding stock. Third Point purchased almost 1.7 million shares at $15.82 per share, and another 804,000 shares at $15.67 per share, according to the filing with regulators.
